Trait description: The amount of a grain sample that does not pass through the holes of a sieve of defined size, expressed as a percentage weight of the entire sample.
The amount of protein in the grain, expressed as a percentage of the whole grain.

Method description: Calculated as the weight of the groat divided by the weight of the whole grain, multiplied by 100. Kernels are typically dehulled using a Codema oat dehuller, which processes a 50 gram sample.

Trait description: The amount of oil in the groat, expressed as a percentage of the groat.
The amount of protein in the groat, expressed as a percentage of the groat.

Trait description: The plants tolerance to acid soil.
Method description: Observe the growth of plants per plot/entry in a low pH (acid) soil field and rate the tolerance.

Trait description: The plants tolerance to lower temperatures than the optimum.
Method description: Observe the growth of plants per plot/entry at temperature lower than the optimum temperature and rate the tolerance.

Method description: Observe the growth of plants per plot/entry under droughted condition and rate the tolerance.

Context of use: Characterization in pedigree nurseries and evaluation in trials.
Trait description: A qualitative analysis of the type of crown rust symptoms that are exhibited.
Method description: Visual assessment of the disease reaction. Infection types are limited to: Resistant (R): chlorotic fleck reaction with no sporulation, Moderately resistant (MR): Very small, non- or low-sporulating pustule surrounded by chlorosis, Moderately susceptible (MS): moderate to large pustule surrounded by extensive chlorosis, and, Susceptible (S): large pustule with little or no chlorosis.

Context of use: Characterization in pedigree nurseries and evaluation in trials
Trait description: A qualitative analysis of the type of stem rust symptoms that are exhibited.
Method description: Visual assessment of the disease reaction. Infection types are limited to: Resistant (R): chlorotic fleck reaction with no sporulation, Moderately resistant (MR): Very small, non- or low-sporulating pustule surrounded by chlorosis, Moderately susceptible (MS): moderate to large pustule surrounded by extensive chlorosis, and, Susceptible (S): large pustule with little or no chlorosis.

Trait description: Dry biomass of all above ground plant parts.
Method description: Cut all aboveground biomass in a predetermined area. Dry to a constant weight and weigh using a scale or balance.

Trait description: Fresh biomass of all above ground plant parts.
Method description: Cut all aboveground biomass in a predetermined area and weigh immediately using a scale or balance.

Trait description: Dry biomass of all below ground plant parts.
Method description: Recover as much below ground biomass as possible. Wash to remove excess soil. Dry to a constant weight and weight on a scale or balance.

Trait description: Fresh biomass of all below ground plant parts.
Method description: Recover as much below ground biomass as possible. Wash to remove excess soil and weight on a scale or balance.

Measure the chaff fresh biomass.

Method description: Separate all fertile tillers from the sample. Dry to a constant weight and weigh using a scale or balance.

Method description: Separate all fertile tillers from the sample and weigh immediately using a scale or balance.

Method description: Separate all leaves with green area greater than 50% from the sample. Dry to a constant weight and weigh using a scale or balance.

Trait description: Fresh biomass of all leaves that have a green area > 50%.
Method description: Separate all leaves with green area greater than 50% from the sample and weigh immediately using a scale or balance.

Method description: Separate all leaves with green area less than 50% from the sample and weigh immediately using a scale or balance.
Separate all panicles from the sample. Dry to a constant weight and weigh using a scale or balance.
Separate all panicles from the sample and weigh immediately using a scale or balance.
